ygData.subject: Re: Lets find Bidl Frugin
ygData.msgSnippet: sorry to say, but dont believe a frigging word the GMs say. they also told me that compasses were *not* broken in anyway, and that we could make them, this is
ygData.messageBody:
sorry to say, but dont believe a frigging word the GMs say.
they also told me that compasses were *not* broken in anyway, and that
we could make them, this is *before* they made our toolboxes have 8
slots. Whoosh, there goes 100pp and 2 hours of time trying everything I
could think of to get them to work.... We did petition and were told
that they were, infact, tinkerable (is this a word?).
4 days later they patch the toolbox and suddenly, viola, we really can
make compasses...
/Nosferatu

MadGrizzle wrote:
>
> From: MadGrizzle <MadGrizzle@...>
>
> Well, i've heard from an "assistant guide" (sarcasm) that said tinkering
> was fully functional and said to go exploring.
> Not sure if I believe him, but him, he was very tight lipped.
>
> Are we sure that its not working or do we think that it is because we can't
> find the plans for some items.
>
> As for the bug using cams, has anyone tried to combine them with an oak or
> an darkwood staff? regular cams don't work
> for hickory, elm, or ashwoods. I haven't tried it yet on an oak or a
> darkwood cause I am relatively poor.
>
> At 02:30 PM 07/22/1999 +0000, you wrote:
> >From: "Catbik Tinkerton" <catbik@...>
> >
> >I think you guys gotta realize that tinkering is just plain bugged and you
> >have to wait till they fix it.
> >
> >-Catbik
> >
